data.title: Excellent pizza and great atmosphere!
data.text: Date night was excellent here! Downtown location with tables looking outside is a great environment. Pizza is fabulous and service very friendly! Sausage and pepperoni pizza was our choice and it did not disappoint!

data.title: Great place for pizza
data.text: The pizza is very good. We have dined in and had carry out. Every time we are very happy. Slices are very big an filling. Good beer selection. Not much seating and can be full during the lunch hours. However very quick service. One of the best places for pizza downtown.

data.title: Great little place!
data.text: Great salad, must have the spinach salad.  Cheese pizza is great, so I am sure all the others are good as well.  Love ordering and sitting outside on a nice evening!

data.title: Delicious first time.
data.text: They had 4 kinds of pizza available by the slice and breadsticks available too. Pepperoni, Cheese, and 2 kinds of specialty: chicken, onion, cheddar and spinach, roasted red pepper, banana pepper. All delicious. Breadsticks came with one sauce but ordered all 3; garlic butter, cheese, marinara. Nice beer selection & fountain Coke. Sat outside then came in during rain. Sat in window table. Perfection!

data.title: Best Pizza in Fort Wayne or Anywhere!!!
data.text:
By far the best pizza by the slice anywhere and best food for the value in Fort Wayne! 
They offer about 4 pizzas by the slice each night.  
If you want to purchase an entire pizza pie, you can build your own. 
Salads contain amble lettuce, cheese and ingredients at affordable prices. 
Servers are always friendly. 
Please do not let the small dining room distract you.  Customers can dine outside on patio and upstairs in what doubles as a dance hall. 

Any time I visit Fort Wayne, Pint and Slice is on my itinerary with their pizza in my stomach.

data.title: Basic pizza and calzone place
data.text: Had calzones here, which were decent. The place was busy and pretty dirty - we had to clear our own table. Wait was a little longer than expected, but the quality of the food is what you expect at a basic greasy pizza place.

data.title: Best slice in town!
data.text: By the slice or by the pie, this place is hands down best in taste. The pies are made to order, ahead, and carry out. Several choices on display to be warmed in the oven upon ordering. (though I have never known one to need much warming as they go so fast)

data.title: Great pizza!
data.text: I always get a slice of pizza and a Caesar salad!  Love it here!  It gets busy but try upstairs seating if downstairs is packed!  Always good pizza!

data.title: Big city feel for a medium sized town
data.text: Good food and a fun downtown setting, definitely more to try out there for return trip. The salads were fresh, the pizza was tasty New York style, and when the weather's nice eating outside is a great option

data.title: Great pizza
data.text: This is the best pizza in town.  The staff is friendly and the atmosphere always welcoming.  Great for lunch or to take a pizza home for dinner.

data.title: Great Pizza and Atmosphere
data.text: We stopped in for lunch after the Three Rivers Festival Parade. The pizza was very good and reasonably priced. The cheesy bread is awesome - very cheesy and gooey right from the oven. Service is fast when you order by the slice. The upstairs seating area had larger tables and was a little quieter. A good local establishment with character. We'll definitely be back.

data.title: Quick and delicious
data.text: Stepped in for lunch and was served quickly with piping hot fresh pizza.  3 slices of pizza and 3 drinks cost $14.  There's out door seating. Inside is small and quaint but room to move around.

data.title: Good Value, Superb ambiance will be eating there again.
data.text:
Cannot beat this for a quick bite out with a crowd up to 8. Booths, group tables, and al fresco are all available.

Beers on tap paired well to pizza by the slice. Specialty pizza menu is worth exploring.

Crust is voluminous and bready but with the crunch and bite texture of New York pizza.

Ordered a Caesar side salad. Lettuce a little sad but excellent value.

Generous with the cheese.

I will return.

data.title: Pretty tasty
data.text: This is pretty good standard pizza. If you are looking for traditional flavors, it's a good option. If you prefer something more upscale, it doesn't compete with 800 Degrees in my opinion.

data.title: Best local pizzeria
data.text: I love their pizza and side salads. They have many local beers and a cozy atmosphere. I dont like calzones but I have been told they are very good!

data.title: Like the name says...
data.text: Charming place, charming servers. Good slice of pepperoni, generous small Greek salad, and a pint of good IPA - under $12 before tip.

data.title: Good pizza, good atmosphere
data.text: The pizza is pretty good and the atmosphere is also well done.  I like the tables in the front windows up on a higher level so you can look out onto the street while you eat.

data.title: Old and dried out pizza
data.text: I was looking for a by-the-slice pizzeria and this was the first to pop up...I greatly regret it, the pizza had been sitting out what seemed for days. I am from NY and will never eat here again, especially with Big Apple pizza available in Richards Bakery.

data.title: Pizza by the Slice
data.text: LOVE that you can either order pizza by the slice for a quick lunch or a whole pizza for a night with the family! Also great to be able to drink a pint while you're there!

data.title: Excellent Pizza
data.text: Would be a 5 star rating if the place was bigger. If you can get a table then it is top notch. Pizza is the best around and the prices are reasonable.
